messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> >So said rahuls_25 on 2003-08-07 --------------------
> >Hi,
> >I am a newbie to JUnit and my company uses automatic build to run
> >test cases written in Junit for each java class. But, we are not
> >testing EJBs currently as it would involve creating .ear file and
> >testing. So, can anybody tell me what is the best way to test
Entity,
> >session and message beans and servlets? Is there anyway to test
JSPs?
> >Any samples/links provided will be much appreciated.
>
> My coauthor and I will devote approximately 100 pages to this in
our upcoming book. Please understand that we can't do it by
tomorrow. :)
>
> Since you are testing code already written, my strong suggestion is
to start by testing through the end-user interface or using a package
like Cactus. Thorough and fast testing of EJBs requires a certain
design approach that not many people take.
>

I just read an article titled as "Test Infect Your Enterprise
JavaBeans" from java.sun.com. I am not sure the approach presented
there is still recommended or not as it is dated back to 2000. The
web page link is

http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/technicalArticles/J2EE/testinf
ect/#resources

Thanks & Regards!
